intro: Stegnogramma australis, commonly known as the Australian starwort, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and often edible plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky areas. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a distinctive veining pattern. Stegnogramma australis produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, which are characteristic of the Apiaceae family.
